website_summaries.verdict: Updated edition of the long-standing guide to an academically rigorous yet enjoyable education.
pros: Detailed method that progresses in a specific linear way as child's mind matures
Updated version includes curricula recommendations and new math and science considerations
Addresses modern standardized testing, high school-level education, college transcripts, and related issues
cons: Very long, and some ideas seem a bit dated
Section on special needs and learning styles is not terribly helpful

customer_reviews.title: New and improved
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this book. I was a little hesitant to purchase since I have the older version, but there is so much that has been updated. The literature selections by grade level alone make this money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL FOR ANYONE WANTING WELL-EDUCATED CHILDREN
customer_reviews.text: This book feels a little like a manual, but it is seriously the massive guide on what, how, when, where to do 95% of your child's education, especially if you're home educating. HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend. I have used this method for my pre-school aged children, and i have seen a massive difference between my children and others. In addition, I'm a teacher, and I have used the middle school aged techniques in the classroom with success. But seriously, if you're going to home educate at all-- you need this book as your home plate. You can adjust as needed for your child and lifestyle. This book is the BOMB DOT COM!
customer_reviews.author: _Haley_

customer_reviews.title: best homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on homeschooling this is a great book, but it can over whelm you, don't expect to sit down and read it cover to cover consecutively though. This will give you lesson planning to subject material, this book will set you up with ALL the info you need to home school, you will still have to acquire your curriculum but they give you several to chose from on every subject.
customer_reviews.author: lizzard

customer_reviews.title: A great starting point for re-evaluating education
customer_reviews.text: Good resource. You don't have to agree with everything the author says to appreciate her pedagogy, and the time spent to prepare this book. I do think it's way overpriced, however. As a heads-up, she advocates reading before writing- the opposite of the Montessori approach. I take what she says and fine tune it with actual scientific research in educational psychology. My results are wonderful as a result. However, every student/teacher combo is different, and what works for some may not for others.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Quality book.
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Homeschool must read. We have done Classical Conversation for two years. My daughter is just finishing the first grade. I wish I had read this book sooner but I'm glad to have it now. It's packed with information to help you succeed. It gives scheduling ideas, goes through different curriculums available. Tons of information on how and why.
customer_reviews.author: autumnleaves

customer_reviews.title: My fault! Wrong perception on what the book was.
customer_reviews.text: What I expected was a brief excursion into various topics that improve your education, along with references for furthering such an endeavour. Well, that is what this book is, sort of. It is actually a manual for the creation of a good home schooling project. Home schooling may be a great way to go about what I was expecting. It is more a book "about" what a good education is about than a book that actually gives you a more rounded education. For what the book is actually about, it does an excellent job!
customer_reviews.author: DantheMan

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I’d say this is the Bible of homeschooling!! So much wonderful info in one book so much that put me at ease and it is written thoughtfully for the homeschooling parent.
customer_reviews.author: CherCher

customer_reviews.title: Must Read for Homeschool Classical Education!
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing. It is not only incredibly helpful with endless lists of resources, but it is FUN and inspiring to read! I was extremely hesitant to ever even consider homeschooling my kids. But I knew if I did, I would want to do so using the classical model. A friend recommended this book to me and I am eternally grateful that she did. It has transformed my idea of what homeschooling can be. I'm now inspired and excited to homeschool my kids, using this resource to help every step along the way!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great homeschooling classic update
customer_reviews.text: A great homeschooling classic update. As always, the Well-Trained Mind offers parents plenty of good advice and recommended resources.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Capshaw

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for new homeschool families.
customer_reviews.text: Though I have strayed far (and I mean far) from this book, I still keep it on my shelf. It helped me imagine homeschooling as this possible thing. I plan to read through it each summer. A MUST have for any homeschooler.
customer_reviews.author: A. Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing read
customer_reviews.text: Amazing book i loved it. Its really worth the excitement that so many homeschool parents have around it ! Loved it and I'm sure I will use it throughout my journey
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Henrich

customer_reviews.title: This book is a great resource for homeschoolers and parent's looking to supplement their ...
customer_reviews.text: Very inspirational! This book is a great resource for homeschoolers and parent's looking to supplement their children's education. There is so much information packed into this book, I find myself re-reading sections over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice book. A complete must have for homeschooling parents
customer_reviews.text: Nice book. I have wanting this book since I have heard about it. I borrowed this book from one of very good friend who is homeschooling her daughter from last 5 years and really raves about this book. Read few pages of this and I was completely sure I need to get my hands on this one. Amazing book.
customer_reviews.author: Mimilovestoshop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book! I highly recommend this book for any ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book! I highly recommend this book for any parent who is wanting to contribute to their child's education, whether supplementing their public school education to homeschooling. She gives great advice and encouragement, and the end of each chapter has an extensive list of refommended resources.
customer_reviews.author: PSFpartyof5

customer_reviews.title: Solid Classical Education Resource.
customer_reviews.text: This book has been our educational outline for many years. Love the new edition with updated resource lists.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Its a great resource for homeschooling familiies
customer_reviews.text: Anyone looking at homeschooling with the classical model of education should get this book! Its a great resource for homeschooling familiies.
customer_reviews.author: CrunchyMama

customer_reviews.title: and I liked it then
customer_reviews.text: I read the 2004 edition a couple of years ago, and I liked it then. But this one is even better. It is so helpful, and it has been a wonderful resource as I've started my homeschooling journey.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Raty

customer_reviews.title: A must
customer_reviews.text: It takes the guessing out of curriculum snd guides you step by step from pre-k all the way to 12 grade.
customer_reviews.author: roan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE.
customer_reviews.text: Very thorough, rigorous homeschool curriculum. This is actually my second copy of this book as I had worn out the 3rd edition. This has the same basic info with updated curriculum suggestions. LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: snuggle me

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool must-have
customer_reviews.text: This is a homeschool parents best friend! As a new HS mom this has become my go-to resource. Especially if you’re looking for a secular resource. An excellent explanation of the argument for classical education and how it prepares children to THINK, not just perform on tests. A must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: This book is wealth of information and resources. We have been homeschooling 2nd year now and I wish I bought it before I started. It’s like your personal navigator throughout the journey. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to for anything homeschool. I have told ...
customer_reviews.text: My new go-to for anything homeschool. I have told numerous people About it! This is the book I have been desiring for YEARS!!! Now I know it exists! Thank you so much for writing it
customer_reviews.author: Sarah in Paradise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic for anyone who wants to integrate elements of classical teaching methods into their teaching. It is helpful for the practitioner and parent alike. Certain elements may not apply for every teacher.
customer_reviews.author: sound1221

customer_reviews.title: A great place to start regarding how to expose youth to the classics
customer_reviews.text: In an era when classical Western values are under assault, it is refreshing to find a volume on how to approach to educating the young on how to think through exposure to the classics. Not the last word, but a great place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great homeschooling guide. I love the attention to detail and the references to great curriculum.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding guide to a Classical education. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: A must-read!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book to not only homeschool parents but any parent with school-age kids. This book is so thoughtfully written and has awesome strategies.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: A must read for all parents, whether you plan to home educate or not
customer_reviews.author: Kendel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Guideline to a Classical Education
customer_reviews.text: I use this book as a guideline when choosing curriculum for homeschooling. I find the reading lists for high school history/literature very helpful when you are putting together your own curriculum instead of using a "boxed" one. Would highly recommend to those who are interested in using this as a guide to giving their children a classical education.
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoGammy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a very thorough and comprehensive walk-through of homeschooling. It actually explains the holes that I always felt were there in my own education. This is absolutely how I want to teach my son; our local school system is pretty abysmal. In fact, I'm fairly certain that most of the class about to graduate from the high school don't even know what abysmal means. It makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: bookgrl

customer_reviews.title: If you want to homeschool classically this is a great help! I don't use all her suggestions but ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want to homeschool classically this is a great help! I don't use all her suggestions but it is a very helpful guide.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully done update to an already awesome book
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent with all of its updated materials. I Have read the original one from cover to cover, but this one has excellent resources, including price lists and internet links to relevant information. It is well worth upgrading the the most recent edition.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah MacDougall

customer_reviews.title: Practical classical education plan
customer_reviews.text: Excellent how-to reference book for those wanting to provide a solid college-prep education for their own kids at home. Helps with the nitty gritties of homeschooling, from teaching reading to chemistry. Down-to-earth practical advice for homeschooling families who want a reliable academic plan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful & thorough
customer_reviews.text: Well written, easy to follow concepts, a very good informative read.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful resource
customer_reviews.text: More than I expected it to be! A wonderful resource. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A homeschool must have
customer_reviews.text: A great guide, gives lots of up to date curriculum options.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma B. Hale

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This book is a must if you are homeschooling or supplementing your child that goes to school. I couldn’t be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: This book is a great tool and I have read it more times than ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the third edition, my sister has the second and I still wanted a Kindle edition of the fourth for the updates as well as the repeat of what I've already read. This book is a great tool and I have read it more times than I can count.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret C.

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have For Homeschool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book to homeschool for the first time this year and it was immensely helpful. I decided to not purchase any curriculum, and this book gave me the direction I need. I don't follow it religiously, and I love that I am able to make adaptions to my child's needs. It's a must-have for any homeschooling parent. My son is 13 and in 7th grade, but this book works well for any grade level. It also has information for parents who are starting this method later in their schooling, which was extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Geeky Mama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a classical education program
customer_reviews.text: Loved the third edition and when this one came I gifted my other one. Our kids are capable of so much more than public school expects from them. We use this to supplement their schooling.
customer_reviews.author: Anchored

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely indispensable
customer_reviews.text: This book has provided the road map I needed to engage in providing my children with a classical education at home. Absolutely indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Herron

customer_reviews.title: A terrific resource
customer_reviews.text: I have an intelligent special needs child being left behind by traditional schooling. Common Core and the horrific creature known as Milestones testing offers nothing for us but frustration. I knew I needed to find something that would not just teach him the basics, but give him the tools to live independently when he reaches adulthood. This resource has provided me with the desperately needed road map that will not only help us escape an underperforming system, but the confidence that I can teach my son myself.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jock

customer_reviews.title: One of the best homeschool guides
customer_reviews.text: One of the best homeschool guides. It is thorough, with guidelines and ideas for preschool through high school, it contains a path that can help your homeschoolers prepare not only to be successful and prepared for college, but to be prepared for learning at the best universities, including ivy league schools. My daughter was sought after by MIT, Stanford, Columbia, and many other excellent schools because of her ACT score in part because of the excellent resources that I found through this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amu

customer_reviews.title: Solid advice. Helpful tips. It is a long ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid advice. Helpful tips. It is a long read, however. The newer edition has some helpful updated material (like more recommendations).
customer_reviews.author: jsuave6

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reference for all homeschooling mothers to have on their desk.
customer_reviews.author: AJTW

customer_reviews.title: Great book. Checked it out from the library first
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Checked it out from the library first, then felt like we needed it for home and for home-school for we bought it and this has been a great copy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful, well thoughtout guide to schooling. Tremendously realistic and thorough guide with valuable and appropriate resources provided.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book.  A must-have for homeschoolers interested in classical education.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like forever before the book arrived in the mail, but it did arrive and I am loving it! This book is full of information, cover to cover and is a must have resource for homeschooling parents who want to broaden their methods of teaching. It can be used as a full curriculum (they recommend all the spine books you might need) or as a reference to beef up and strengthen your current methods. I will be marking it up and bookmarking pages for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: bteoacr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gaining a lot of great information out of this. It's really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: tigermother3

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool must have
customer_reviews.text: Best homeschooling guide. If you’re struggling WHAT to teach, this book is like a homeschool bible.
customer_reviews.author: laurajw07

customer_reviews.title: It gives you a nice schedule and good overview of what to do and ...
customer_reviews.text: It gives you a nice schedule and good overview of what to do and what is available in home-schooling materials. I wish I had had a book like this when I was starting out.
customer_reviews.author: alex r

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you want a book on homeschooling, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This book is so helpful and full of information. Though I have been homeschooling for a few years already this book was still very helpful. I was actually already following a classical path, but didn't know it. This book helped me make a few course corrections that have improved our daily routine, and I know it will be a much used resource for years to come. It may not work for everyone, and I don't agree with everything in it, but I imagine it would be useful to nearly anyone. I highly recommend it to anyone that is homeschooling, or thinking about homeschooling.
customer_reviews.author: Libby P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This book has consumed my life since I opened its delectable pages. I lust for this book now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is how we all should have learned!
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out program that will produce adults capable of critical thinking across many disciplines.
customer_reviews.author: James F Rice

customer_reviews.title: Essential for parents of kids with delays.
customer_reviews.text: This new edition is great and will be a huge help as we shepherd our daughter through high school. But for us the real value will be in the help it gives us to educate our 7yo son who has a language disorder. This doesn't just tell you what you should teach; it helps you understand how typical children learn. Knowing that can help you understand where your child might be coming up short and what to do about it. This book, along with the online forums and any regular evaluations and therapy your child needs, can fully equip many parents to teach their special needs kids at home.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wheeless

customer_reviews.title: Good Resource for First Time Secular Homeschooler
customer_reviews.text: This guide has been an invaluable resource for me. I borrowed an older edition from the library before I purchased this one. As a first time homeschooler it gives me a good jumping off point.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book to find good curriculum to supplement child's education
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book to find good curriculum to supplement child's education. Son is currently in public school. I wanted to make sure his weakness are addressed as well as him being challeged at subjects that come easy. This book lets me know where to start. We needed more open and go curriculums with little teacher preparation and her book has guided me towards these curriculums. Hat off to those that home educate you guys have really laid the foundation for us supplementers.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book for parents considering homeschooling their children
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book for parents considering homeschooling their children. I like that the book has a secular approach to education. The authors present a unique viewpoint on how to approach the curriculum - moving from ancient to modern and repeating that process every four years of school.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! It is packed with so much valuable information for traditional/classical homeschooling. I originally borrowed it from our local library but realized this was a book I simply must own. Can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 6

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great help to me and my daughter who is beginning to teach her first born.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey L. Hinely

customer_reviews.title: Perfect start to your homeschool journey
customer_reviews.text: Perfect start to your homeschool journey! It gave me the confidence that I can be my child's teacher without having a teaching education.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree T Blickens

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This book is even more involved than I expected. Not through reading it yet. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great reference
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! Such a great reference, especially for someone just beginning to homeschool. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lovely

product_meta.title: The Well-Trained Mind: A Guide to Classical Education at Home (Fourth Edition)

specifications.Publisher: W. W. Norton & Company; Fourth Edition (August 9, 2016)
